Job.Title: Intermediate Structural Design Engineer
Job.Summary: Step out of the shadows and give your career the jump-start it deserves. Seeking a forward-thinking structural engineer for immediate work.
Job.Description:
The company
A company with a reputation for being more technically capable than their competition, where they believe simple, elegance results in technically apt solutions that meet their client's budget requirements. If you have a few years' structural consulting experience but are looking for a true challenge, an opportunity to excel, to align yourself with an award-winning team, this is it.  

The vacancy
Having experienced strong growth in the last two quarters, the Directors of this prestigious team have made a strategic decision to hire yet again. Entering at a junior to intermediate level, the incumbent will contribute to key structural design projects in the commercial and industrial sectors.

Day to day responsibilities
Your average day will include:
  • Completing calculations to create inspiring and functional designs
  • Liaising with the drafting team to discuss technical issues and fixes
  • Site meetings for your designated projects as you see fit
In 6-12 months, you can expect to be taking on additional responsibilities to progress your career. You may be managing your own projects from cradle to grave and may be advising more junior engineers on their work, to help you with yours.

Requirements
  • Recognised degree in engineering from a reputable university
  • 3+ years' experience in the Melbourne market, enough to thoroughly understand local codes and idiosyncrasies
  • Demonstrated experience designing commercial buildings, institutional and industrial buildings.
  • Experience designing steel and concrete structures
What's in it for you?
Your career will leap-frog due to the reputation of this business. This is not a role for the feeble. If you're committed to your career and ready for the next phase, you'll be rewarded with a salary up to $85k as well as the autonomy to manage your own work and bring on new clients of your own within the supportive environment.  

To apply
For more information or to apply, please call Sanj Shouan on 03 9092 7206. Alternatively, you could email him at s.shouan@aspectpersonnel.com.au.  As a third option, you can click 'apply' below.

Sanj has been recruiting in engineering for six years. If you're considering a career change, he's going to be a great asset in your search. All applications are confidential.

BulletPoints.BulletPoint: Recently refurbished offices spread across three floors.
Impressive project portfolio with more exciting work underway.

Job.Title: Senior Structural Engineer
Job.Summary: Prime example of how bigger is not always better. This company offers an excellent portfolio of work as well as city offices and a stable opportunity.
Job.Description:
The company

A company which prides themselves on offering high levels of service to all their clients. A company with ten key structural engineers and ample support staff to assist. 


The vacancy

Having experienced very strong growth in the last two quarters, this business seeks the services of an additional Senior Structural Engineer. Entering at an senior level, the incumbent will contribute to key structural design projects in the commercial and industrial sectors.


Day to day responsibilities

As a Senior Structural Engineer you will be responsible for delivering the design, documentation and project management of major landmark projects. You will attend initial client visits, resource and coordinate your own team of engineers and drafters, ensure project budgets and deadlines are met, carry our scheme design and design development, coordinate documentation and ensure that client requirements are exceeded. You will use your extensive industry experience to mitigate project risks before they arise.


Requirements

  • 7+ years’ experience in the market
  • Chartership, or eligibility to work towards
  • Demonstrated experience managing the design commercial and industrial buildings.
  • Previous experience designing steel and concrete structures
  • Post tension design experience is also critical


What’s in it for you?

If you’re committed to your career and ready for the next phase, you’ll be offered a salary between $100k and $125k as well as the autonomy to manage your own work and bring on new clients of your own within the supportive, yet niche office environment.  


To apply

For more information or to apply, please call Sanj Shouan on 03 9092 7206. Alternatively, you could email him at s.shouan@aspectpersonnel.com.au.  As a third option, you can click ‘apply’ below.

 

Sanj has been recruiting in engineering for six years. If you’re considering a career change, he’s going to be a great asset in your search. All applications are confidential.

Job.Title: Associate Structural Engineer - Autonomy
Job.Summary: Permanent structural vacancy in a uniquely positioned Melbourne consulting firm. Work alongside the well-known Director with your own portfolio.
Job.Description:
The company

A team of experts in structural design; a niche group dedicated to projects in residential, education, retail and commercial sectors; an organisation proud of their strong partnerships with local and nationally recognised architects. Join this team in as an Associate role and you’ll see your career soar from “same, same” to unique. 

 

The vacancy

Working predominantly from their city based office, you’ll be working alongside the Melbourne Director, managing projects from conception to completion. Leverage new business from existing relationships, lead a small team, drive design and produce effective solutions that meet end-user requirements.

 

Day to day responsibilities

Your average day may include:

·         Meeting with your designated project teams to delegate workload

·         Manage pre-existing and new projects

·         Meet with architects and contractors to discuss progress

·         Mentor your team of two and support them in their engineering career

·         Strategy discussions with the management team

·         Nurturing client relationships howsoever you see fit

·         Attending industry events and representing the business at appropriate events

 

Requirements

·         Bachelor degree from a recognised university

·         10+ years demonstrable structural consulting experience in Victoria

·         Registered Building Practitioner status

·         Demonstrated competency in post-tension and seismic design

·         Basement design experience

·         Applicants with Chartership will be viewed favourably

 

What’s in it for you?

If you’re currently in a role you feel has a dead end, little progression, then this permanent role might be for you. You’ll join a small yet well recognised team with administrative support and organised processes. You’ll be given autonomy to run your own work, autonomy to manage a small team. Memberships will be paid for. Salary package is likely to be $120k - $160k package, to match your experience and ability to contribute long term.

 

To apply

For more information or to apply, please call Sanj Shouan on 03 9092 7206. Alternatively, you could email him at s.shouan@aspectpersonnel.com.au.  As a third option, you can click ‘apply’ below.

 

Sanj has been recruiting in engineering for excess of six years. If you’re considering a career change, he’s going to be a great asset in your search. All applications are confidential.

Job.Title: Structural Design Engineer - Sydney CBD

Job.Description:
The company

If successful, you’ll join a consulting firm with people at the core. You’ll join a team of technically adept engineers, competent at offering fresh ideas and niche solutions to their clients. The other exciting work of this company happens outside of 9am – 5pm. The team band together frequently to volunteer and collaborate within the local community. They also frequently participate and compete in sports activities. Needless to say, it’s a fun and inspiring place to work yet everyone is of course hard-working, professional and diligent on the job.

 

The vacancy

Steady growth across the business has opened up an opportunity for an Intermediate Structural Design Engineer on a permanent basis. Working from the chic Sydney office, you’ll join the team of 65 across a range of engineering disciplines: structures, building services and civil.

 

Day to day responsibilities

  • Design and analysis of large scale, high profile projects.
  • Post tension design
  • Direct liaison with the client to determine innovated design solutions
  • Attending site meetings and inspections.
  • You may also be expected to assist in the development of more junior engineers through supervision and mentoring. 
  • Project management opportunities

Requirements

  • Bachelor of engineering
  • 5+ years’ experience as a Structural Consultant
  • Demonstrated understanding of local codes and standard
  • Previous post tension design experience
  • Experience in steel, re-inforced concrete and post-tension design essential

What’s in it for you?

This is a company many would like to work for. They have newly refurbished city offices and work on award winning projects. Alongside the career opportunity, you’ll be offered a salary package between $80k and $95k.

Your career advancement
In 6+ months it is likely you’ll have the opportunity to develop yourself professionally by taking ownership of large scale projects and becoming directly involved with architects and builders.

Job.Title: Marketing Coordinator | Award winning Recruitment Consultancy | CBD
Job.Summary: Marketing Coordinator for award winning recruitment consultancy. Impressive office with bar and cafe! Work with passionate people. Team environment.
Job.Description:
About Aspect:
Based in the Melbourne's CBD, Aspect Personnel is an award winning Recruitment Consultancy that specialises in recruiting within the built and natural environment. Established for 8 years, Aspect has experienced consistent year-on-year growth, including our strongest year to date in 15/16. Further to this, we have built a corporate culture and brand that we are incredibly proud of.
 
We have indented the need to recruit an additional team member to be voice of our business, and give our stakeholders a better insight into what we do as a business, how we do it, why we do it.

We are looking for someone to lead our marketing and branding efforts to give the world we operate in a better insight into Aspect and allow them to connect with our business in a more meaningful way.
 
Employed as Aspect's first Marketing Coordinator, you will take responsibility for the management of Aspect's brand integrity, digital footprint and social engagement.
 
Reporting directly to Aspect's Operations Manager, you will:
 
• Assist in the development, and manage the implementation, of Aspect's overall marketing strategy
• Create client marketing and presentation materials
• Write, edit and proof content Aspect publications and press releases
• Manage social media channels and online communities
• Manage Aspect's website content
• Assist in the writing, editing and proofing various submissions
• Maintain key supplier relationships
• Manage the annual Aspect event calendar, coordinating all internal and external events
• Produce and distribute all corporate collateral
• Prepare and present monthly marketing reports
    
In addition to your salary, you will also receive: 

• An iPhone 6
• Externally facilitated training program
• Cloud-based technology to support efficiency and mobility 
• 3 days of volunteer leave per year
• Membership to Aspect's Health and Wellbeing Club and Book Club
• Regular team incentives and activities
 
You will also be based in Aspect's new office. We work pretty hard, so we wanted to create a great space to work in. Our new office includes:
 
• Ergonomic workstations
• Hydraulic desks
• Leading IT infrastructure
• A quiet room
• Collaborative work areas and booths for informal meetings
• A fully equipped kitchen including oven and stove top
• A café with commercial-grade coffee machine
• A fully stocked bar
• A breakout area including TV, projector, PlayStation, pool table, and arcade machine
 
We work hard to provide our staff long-term, challenging careers and pride ourselves on the resulting staff retention rate.

   
As the ideal applicant you will have:

• Tertiary qualifications in Marketing (or similar)
• Circa 4+ experience working in a marketing role
• Demonstrated capacity to deliver industry leading marketing strategies
• Exceptional written and verbal communication skills
• Extensive experience in content writing
• The passion to understand, embrace and promote a corporate brand
• Prior experience in relationship building and key stakeholder management
• Strong decision-making and influencing skills
• The ability to work autonomously
• Excellent attention to detail
• The desire to love where you work and have fun while there.
 
This is an exciting time to join a growing, successful firm and provides a great opportunity for a creative and passionate marketing professional to stamp their mark on the Aspect business.

How to apply:    
If you are interested to find out more about this opportunity, please call Aspect's Operations Manager, Chantelle Polites, on 03 9092 7222 or 0414 534 404, or e-mail her at c.polites@aspectpersonnel.com.au.
       
For more information about Aspect, please check out our website at www.aspectpersonnel.com.au or our blog at www.aspectpersonnel.com.au/blog.
       
All conversations will be strictly confidential.

Job.Title: Landscape Architect | Local Council | Inner Northern Suburbs
Job.Summary: Local Council in inner North seeks experienced LA to assist with Playspace and Reserve upgrades and redesigns
Job.Description:
This Local Council based in the Inner North has over 140 Reserves within its' municipality and prides itself on its' open space policy.

Having recently conducted an audit of their green space, Council have identified a number of reserves and play spaces that require upgrading. These works range from minor to whole areas requiring re-designing and new furniture. As such, they are seeking an experienced and autonomous Landscape Architect to draw up Masterplans and designs for these areas.

Working alongside the Open Space Coordinator, Open Space Planner and Design Engineer you will work on a range of projects from now until the End of Financial Year.
The role may be extended beyond this, and so it is an excellent opportunity to get stuck into a design role within a Local Council.

Due to the nature of work involved, Council are seeking a candidate with the below experience:
  • A tertiary qualification in Landscape Architecture
  • Proven experience as a Landscape Architect, preferably within a Local Council or at least with great experience working on Council projects, particularly reserves and playspaces
  • Experience with both Masterplanning and detailed design
  • Experience in using AutoCAD
  • Full Victorian Drivers' License
We constantly have Landscape Architecture opportunities within Local Councils across Victoria. These can be permanent, long term and short term opportunities.

For a confidential discussion regarding this role and other Landscape Architecture roles across Local Councils in Victoria, please contact Beth Buist on 9092 7213 or apply online or by emailing your resume to b.buist@aspectpersonnel.com.au

Job.Title: Civil Engineer - Commercial Buildings - Progress toward senior
Job.Summary: Savvy civil engineer sought for engineering consultancy located CBD fringe. Int - senior level design skills and a desire to work toward big things!
Job.Description:
The company

An engineering consultancy that offers the full breadth of consulting services. A consulting firm with excess of 150 staff across five offices. A wholly Australian company known for producing high quality design that deliver buildable, economical solutions.

 

The vacancy

Due to an interstate move, this civil team are looking for a Mid-level or Senior Civil Engineer who has worked on building projects in very recent years. The successful candidate will be hired on a permanent basis to assist with design and documentation and will be expected to manage project flow and delegate to others to effectively manage project load.

 

Day to day responsibilities

Day to day, you will create exceptional designs for projects, both new and existing. You will be given projects to nurture and be responsible for managing design hours as well as updating the client and liaising with other engineering disciplines to finalise documentation.   

 

In 12+ months, it is likely you will have your own small project portfolio and some repeat work. You will be able to continue relationships with current clients and expand your technical expertise to become a more experienced senior engineer, working toward career advancement.

 

Requirements

  • Civil Engineering Degree from a recognised university
  • Advanced design skills using Civil3D or 12D
  • A desire to work toward chartership and improve your personal capabilities
  • Victorian experience enough to understand the civil engineering building market
  • Demonstrated experience designing car parks, retaining walls, drainage and other civil associated building works to Australian codes

What’s in it for you?

Career development. City based offices. Intimate teamwork. Varied projects achieved through strong relationships with architects. On offer is a salary between $70k and $105k package.

 

To apply

For more information or to apply, please call Adam Brown on 03 9092 7203. Alternatively, you could email him at a.brown@aspectpersonnel.com.au.  As a third option, you can click ‘apply’ below.

 

Adam has been recruiting in civil engineering for ten years. If you’re considering a career change, he’s going to be a great asset in your search. All applications are confidential.

Job.Summary: A highly regarded engineering firm is seeking a Structural Engineer to compliment their established team. With a busy project workload.
Job.Description:
This is an ideal opportunity for an experienced Structural Engineer to move into a permanent, secure role at one of Melbourne's leading Structural Engineering consultancies.
  
Based on the fringe of Melbourne's CBD, our client has developed an enviable reputation for successfully delivering a range of building projects throughout Victoria. Established for over 20 years, they have developed a loyal list of clients in both the public and private sector.
  
As a result of a continually growing project workbook, they are looking to employ an additional intermediate Structural Engineer on a permanent basis. Typical projects include medium-rise residential and commercial buildings, shopping centres, hospitals and aged care facilities as well as a range of high end residential properties:
  
Working within an established team of professionals, you will report directly to the company's directors. As a key member of the engineering team, you will be responsible for both structural design and analysis, as well as the management of projects. More specifically, your responsibilities will include: 

  • Structural design and analysis of RC, steel, timber and masonry
  • Overseeing projects and ensuring they are delivered on time and to budget.
  • Completing site inspection and coordinating with builders
  • Liaising with architects and clients
  • Coordinating structural drafters
This is a key role and as a result we are seeking structural engineers with specific experience and skill sets. Suitable candidates will have: 
  • Completed their Bachelor of Engineering
  • Circa 4+ years experience working within a consulting environment
  • Extensive experience in the design or RC, steel, timber, pre-cast concrete and masonry
  • Past experience working on medium scale commercial, residential and institutional projects
  • Comprehensive knowledge of relevant BCA and standards
  • Previous experience in the management of projects from conception to completion
  • Extensive experience liaising with various project stakeholders
  • Exceptional communication and presentation skills
  • Excellent time management skills 
This position offers the successful candidate a secure role within a busy consultancy. Furthermore, there is the immediate opportunity to further develop your experience and play a more significant role in the company's management team.
  
While the estimated salary for the role is approximately $80,000- $95,000.00, there is flexibility and each application will be treated individually.
  
This is an ideal opportunity to join a successful consultancy which promises career progression, boasts a positive work environment, and promotes a healthy work/life balance.

Job.Title: Principal Infrastructure Engineer
Job.Summary: Leading Design Consultancy, with offices across multiple continents, require a senior level Civil Engineer to head their new Melbourne Transport team
Job.Description:
We are strategically working with a major, global Engineering Design Consultancy to expand their already dominant position in other states of Australia and the Middle East, into Melbourne and plug into what is an exciting market with a vibrant future in the Transport sector, in Melbourne.

With a flurry of transport projects in the pipeline, this poses an amazing opportunity for a senior candidate with Tier 1 consultant or state road authority backgrounds. You would sit in a managers role with a ready to go design team provided to you but with the freedom to build and expand the team and it's position in the market. 

The candidate should have at least 10 - 15 years' experience in the design of civil engineering projects, with an emphasis on road and highway projects for state road authorities or equivalent. A sound technical knowledge of Australian design practices (Austroads) and state road authority standards are essential. A broad knowledge of the overall road design process and sub-disciplines (drainage, road safety barriers etc) is required.  Good written and spoken communication is a key requirement.

As this is a 'break the local market' type role, business development is a key component as well as great management skills to lead and develop your team. 
 
You will be the holder of a Bachelor Of Civil Engineer (or equivalent) and be eligible for membership to Engineers Australia. 

You will be rewarded with a generous salary structure and bonuses with a career path and potential equity on offer as well.

Jobs like this one DO NOT come up very often, so if you fit the above brief, get in touch for a confidential conversation. Call ADAM BROWN on 03 9092 7203 and forward a recent copy of your resume to a.brown@aspectpersonnel.com.au

Job.Description:

Job.Title: Landscape Site Manager
Job.Summary: Environmental Restoration and Ecological Consultancy | Manage a range of landscape projects including civil, horticultural and ecological restoration
Job.Description:
There is an immediate need for a Landscape Site Manager/Skilled Landscaper to join this Ecological Consultancy based in Port Melbourne. With five core service divisions including consultancy, nursery, revegetation, wetland and landscape management, you will be working in a diverse team to deliver projects with a focus on ecological restoration.

Reporting to the Senior Project Manager, you will be responsible for construction supervision and hands on construction on a range of projects to include residential, civil, commercial, ecological restoration and industrial. 

Day to day duties will include:
  
• Supervision of staff and subcontractors on site
• Accurate reporting on the progress of projects
• Coordination of stakeholders such as suppliers, contractors and other internal divisions
• Implementation of time and cost improvements on projects
• Selection of appropriate equipment for completion of jobs
• Review and communicate labour and resourcing requirements and assist in recruitment, training and development of staff
• Identify and price variations for existing projects and upsell goods to clients
  
The successful candidate will demonstrate the following
• Qualification in Landscape Construction with at least 5 years' experience in a landscape construction role
• Experience on a range of projects including civil works, horticultural and landscape projects with hands on practical construction knowledge
• An understanding and keen interest in sustainable design and restoration
• Strong leadership ability, communication and interpersonal skills
• Current drivers licence
• Bobcat, medium rigid truck, excavator tickets and licences and construction industry white card
  
If you feel you have the skills and experience to succeed in this role, please follow the link below to apply.
